We offer two equivalent approaches to the mathematical concept of continuous functions. Here is a brief sketch:

li.para: The ‘epsilon-delta’ definition of continuity. At first sight it might appear a bit mysterious. It is, however, quite effective in that it is capable of vast generalization. This generalization is implemented within the theory of ‘Point Set Topology’.

The ‘limit definition’ of continuity. It is quite intuitive: a continuous function f must satisfy: whenever a sequence (x_n) converges to a point x, then the sequence (f(x_n)) converges to f(x). – In other words: f(x) can not jump away from the points f(x_n).
